greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A062129 written in base 10.
comment: Differs from A062130 only for those n, which are palindromes in base 2.
program: (ARIBAS): stop := 500; for k := 0 to 80 do c := 0; m := k; test := true; while test and c < stop do inc(c); m := m + bit_reverse(m); test := m <> bit_reverse(m); end; if c < stop then write(m); else write(-1); end; write(" "); end;.
results.author: _Klaus Brockhaus_, Jun 06 2001
